title: Basics of the Sales Funnel
headline: Learn the art of selling as well as fundamental sales techniques for products and services with this free online course.
description: Fundamentals of the Sales Funnel is a free online course designed to help you understand the basic methods and techniques for conducting successful sales of products or services to customers. This sales course explains sales processes for capturing the hearts and minds of modern customers along with learning what motivates people to make a purchase, how to pitch what you are selling, get referrals, and seal the deal.
courseDescription:
In these modern times, almost everything involves some sort of selling - be it a brand, product or service to consumers, existing customers or other businesses. There are a host of basic sales tools you need to be aware of as a salesperson including product or service information. The basic sales process includes, how to make a good impression, knowing what the customer wants, how to hone your persuasion skills and how to seal the deal. This free online Fundamentals of the Sales Funnel course delves into the basic methods and techniques for conducting successful sales to a variety of different customer archetypes. You will learn how to convince traditional businesses to purchase your product or service using special marketing and sales approaches as well as sales tools to take that sale from “prospect” to “done”.

How you approach people and a great first impression are critical in the sales process because good rapport with someone could result in referrals to friends, family and acquaintances. This course covers the steps you need to take in order to ensure a good, lasting impression and amicable professional relationship that could result in future sales. In order to be an expert salesperson, you need to understand the basics of what motivates customers to part with their money for your product or service. The course content covers the psychological aspects of sales and how to put together quick, appropriate sales pitches when you are under pressure to get it done. You will learn how to sell by listening including how to identify customer problems and pain points to make sure the customer’s needs are met.

Understanding the personal qualities and methods it takes to make sales is a fundamental part of being a well-rounded, successful salesperson. You need to think of many potential scenarios, customers and everything in between in order to sell your product or service. This sales course covers every aspect and consideration you may have whether you are a seasoned salesperson or considering a career in sales. These skills can also be used in a variety of other jobs that require negotiation or persuasion in all their many forms and you should definitely enrol if you want to improve your sales- or interpersonal relationships as well.  

Start Course Now

• Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • List useful tools that salespersons use in successfully sealing different deals.
    • Define in simple terms what a sale is.
    • Discuss how to handle sale objections from customers and clients.
    • Recall the common classification of sales.
    • Relate customer needs as an aspect of preparing calls for a sale.
    • Explain the concept of sales pitching.
    • Describe customer objections and how to handle them.

  • Handling Objections

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • A sale can be defined as the process of convincing someone that you have something they want and making them realize that what you have merits them spending their hard-earned money on it.
    • Sales are often classified into:
      - Telemarketing
      - Direct mail
      - e-mail
      - The internet, and
      - Person-to-person.
    • Preparing calls involves learning about what your client needs together with how you can meet those needs.
    • Good sales calls include both aspects of verbal and non-verbal communications.
    • A sales pitch is a persuasive explanation of what your product or service can do for a customer or client.
    • Customer objections are statements about what is holding them back from purchasing your product or service. It is a character of customers who are not ready to decide on a purchase.
    • Many customer objections are easily overcome by handling them in calm and rational ways.

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Outline the outcomes of a good follow up on a successful sale.
    • Describe the functions of setting good goals for salespeople.
    • Recall the components of SMART goals.
    • Identify the importance of setting sales goals.
    • Compare manual systems and computerized systems of managing sales data.
    • Define the functionalities of a prospect board.

  • Aspects of Sale - Conclusion

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • A good salesperson needs to know when it is a good time to close a deal and how to go about it.
    • Powerful closing techniques consist of:
      - Delivery date
      - Colours
      - Models, and
      - Quantity
    • The final stage of a sale is following up on the sale and not the closing stage.
    • Referrals and future sales are the two outcomes of following up on a sale.
    • SMART goals are Specific, Measureable, Achievable, Realistic, and Timely.
    • A prospect board is a way of showing where each prospect is in the sales process at any given point in time.
    • Customers always like it when they are respected before, during, and after the closing of deals involving them.

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Identify how to successfully lead potential customers through the buying process of today.
    • Outline innovative strategies to gain more customers or clients for your products and services.
    • List appropriate words to use in agreeing with a customer through a sale process for a product or service.
    • Analyze the business of people and how salespeople happen to be categorized under it.
    • Describe steps for getting to the desired common ground for a salesperson and their customer or client.
    • Describe the different ways to handle price objections.

  • Give People What They Want to Get

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Give People What They Want to Get

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Your powerbase as a salesperson includes:
      - Previous customers
      - Friends
      - Family
      - Friends of friends, and
      - Acquaintances or associates
    • The first rule of selling is to always agree with the customer with the appropriate vocabulary and mannerisms.
    • Buyers believe the words they see in written form more than the words they hear.
    • The set price of a product or service is rarely the issue of concern with customers or clients.
    • People are much more likely to make another purchase after the first purchase.
    • All entrepreneurs recognize that problems mean opportunity for new business and solutions for their clients and customers.
    • You must give people what they want in order to get what you want from them easily.
    • If you are not sold on your product or service, the customer won't be either.

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Distinguish between aspects that make a salesperson a usual salesperson and aspects that make a salesperson an expert.
    • Analyze how salespeople put the responsibility back on the customer in order to help them eventually justify their purchases.
    • State how best a salesperson can help their potential customers and clients.
    • Indicate how differentiated salespeople and marketers can be identified.
    • Describe what the customer really wants out of a sale.
    • Recognize methods of using pricing choices to sell more.

  • Course Wrap Up

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • A good salesperson always tries to be critical of their efforts in selling a product or service.
    • Good questions to have in mind as a salesperson include:
      - Am I doing a good enough job communicating the value of this product or service?
      - How can I communicate better?
      - How can I manufacture urgency?
    • The purpose of framing a customer through calls, pitches, discussions, and meetings is to determine if the potential customer or client is a good fit for business.
    • Scarcities and urgencies are created to generate more sales among new and usual customers or clients.
    • People buy based on emotions and later use logic with reasoning to justify their purchases.
    • Good elevator pitches should talk about:
      - Who you help or what problem you solve.
      - How you can help or solve that problem.
      - How that improves their life.
    • Never thank the customer for buying, rather congratulate them on their purchase.
    • Believe in your product or service else do not sell it at all.
